sentences.en: Chosen carefully, the oils may not only palliate but also cure the condition.
sentences.cn: 如果仔细挑选，挑到的精油不仅可以缓和症状，还可以治愈疾病。

sentences.en: I don't wish to palliate them, I assure you.
sentences.cn: 我不想掩饰, 我可以向你保证.

sentences.en: I shall never attempt to palliate my own foibles by exposing the error of another.
sentences.cn: 我从不想暴露别人的错误,以图掩饰自己的缺点.

sentences.en: I should never attempt to palliate my own foible by expose the error of another.
sentences.cn: 我从不想暴露别人的错误,以图减轻自己的缺点.

sentences.en: Objective: to palliate sufferings of patients, to enhance the success rate of esophagus electrode insertion.
sentences.cn: 目的: 减少病人痛苦, 提高插食管电极的成功率.

sentences.en: Organizations for writers palliate the writer's loneliness, but I doubt if they improve his writing.
sentences.cn: 作家的组织固然可以排遣他们的孤独, 但是我怀疑它们未必能够促进作家的创作.

sentences.en: Tow black don't make a white. You can't palliate your own badness with other's bad deed.
sentences.cn: 两黑不等于一白. 你不能用别人的恶行来掩饰自己的劣迹.

words.tran_cn: 缓和的；掩饰的；可斟酌的
辩解；缓和剂；暂时姑息的手段

trans.tran_en: to reduce the effects of illness, pain etc without curing them

trans.tran_cn: 减轻，缓和（痛苦、疾病等），辩解，掩饰（罪过等）
